description: Odd Catalan numbers; more precisely, A000108(2^n-1).
comments: The next term has 150 digits. - _Harvey P. Dale_, Feb 22 2016
links: David Wasserman, May 07 2007, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..9
H-Y. Lin, Odd Catalan Numbers modulo 2^k, Integers 11 (2011) #A55
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Catalan Number
prog: (Python)from __future__ import divisionA038003_list, c, s = [1, 1], 1, 3for n in range(2,10**5+1):....c = (c*(4*n-2))//(n+1)....if n == s:........A038003_list.append(c)........s = 2*s+1 # _Chai Wah Wu_, Feb 12 2015a(n) = binomial(2^(n+1)-2, 2^n-1)/(2^n); \\ _Joerg Arndt_, Nov 05 2015
author: _Christian G. Bower_
